website_summaries.verdict: This keyboard is tented with palm support and is thought to be suitable for up to eight hours per day of typing.
pros: The two pieces can be separated up to 6 inches
cons: It's expensive, and a few buyers say they felt the price should have been slightly lower for the quality

customer_reviews.title: Finally a great ergonomic mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: As a programmer having a great keyboard is important to me. I've been a longtime user of the Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard series. That keyboard has great ergonomics and key layout, but the membrane keys are really subpar. Until now the closest mechanical keyboard you could get was the Kenesis Freestyle series, which has a similar split design but compromised on the extended keys. Today I unboxed the Cloud Nine C989M and I couldn't be happier with it. It has the same layout as the Microsoft keyboards, but the keys are Cherry MX mechanical keys.
customer_reviews.author: Tom F

customer_reviews.title: only full size keyboard Ergo choice
customer_reviews.text: Best choice for those who love mechanical keyboards, ergo keyboards, and still need a full-size keyboard. This Keyboard commands Desk space. Fingerprint magnet I am not a fan of the Cherry MX browns (personal opinion, I like Linears). But they are a quiet typing experience with the keyboard having a bit of a PING sound with typing. The RGB options will make your jaw drop. My cat is currently mesmerized.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So this is a fantastic keyboard! Comfortable and colorful to the max! Definitely helped with my tensosynovitis! I only have two complaints since it was an expensive keyboard I was shocked to find that the keys are loud compared to other keyboards- not sure why they lacked on this... quiet keys should be a basic thing now. Also, I’m one of those people that like to feel the bump on the F J and 5 key, well the bump is barely there. Other than that this keyboard rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Now that many of us are working from home, I've been looking for an ergonomic keyboard that would help assuage my carpal tunnel syndrome. After looking at a number of different keyboards, this one really caught my eye. The product is very well built: it feels sturdy and it's also incredibly aesthetic. It had some connection issues with my Dell G3 laptop in the beginning but I realized that you just need to make sure that your drivers are updated and that the USB is connected to a 3.0 port. Love it and would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: VCS.

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard... Ever?
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and you've been waiting 10+ years for someone to make a truly ergonomic, *fully functional* mechanical keyboard, then you can purchase this without hesitation! I love it so much that a week later I bought a second to take in to the office. ~20 years of using MS Natural/split keyboards have finally come to an end. I cannot recommend this thing enough!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Moll

customer_reviews.title: best damn keyboard on the market
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this thing at the moment Pros - looks great - software to customize lighting - cherry brown - ergonomic cons - windows key is only on the right side (you can remap and switch keycaps with the left fn key though) - its big - the software could have more options for coloring even though they have a decent selection... make a programming interface?
customer_reviews.author: mas

customer_reviews.title: Only keyboard with all 3: ergonomic, mechanical, numpad
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I've been hunting for a modern equivalent to replace the 90's hit Microsoft Natural Keyboard with no luck for decades. As far as I can tell, this is the only keyboard in existence that's ergonomic, has a numeric keypad, and mechanical switches. Keys are fully programmable, including the Fn and Windows keys, which were swapped from my desired layout.
customer_reviews.author: Lucent

customer_reviews.title: Really Solid Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this. This keyboard is very solid. Typing isn't annoyingly loud, but you know when you're hitting the keys. Installation is a breeze. I don't think I have a bad thing to say about it. It does take a little bit of time to learn to type with your hands separated and if you are a "hunt and peck" or use the "Columbus" method to type there will be a learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Earl

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. It’s worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER leave reviews. Ever. And I love this keyboard. I’ve had a Microsoft ergo keyboard for years but was looking for something with backlighting for typing at night. This keyboard is perfect & I love all the color options. Only issue is how loud the key clicks are when you type but I don’t care - the benefits totally outweigh the sound. I am typing faster - about 10 more WPM than I was before. It’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent mechanical  Ergonomic Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Got it for my office, just ordered a 2nd one for home. My only complaint: The lighted trim around the edges of the keyboard and around the middle wheel are not customizable. Everything else is. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something split, ergonomic, mx brown, good build quality. This is perfect. Software is decent. Uses USB-C cables. Very solid build quality. Types beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash
customer_reviews.text: I have several PCs an multiple USB KVM switches. This keyboard WILL NOT work with any KVM switch. This is a total dealbreaker for me and I am returning this item immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Bajeebers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bit of a learning curve going to a split, but totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Software is bad
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard wont stop throwing up notifications about connecting it to a usb 2. every time it does this, which happens every 30 minutes, it opens up the keyboard interface, this is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kortney dodd

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Finally a backlit ergonomic keyboard! Love everything about this keyboard. The key's are NOT quiet but that's not something I care about.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bright, clicky, beautiful ergonomic mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this thing a day, and I already love it!! I have to use split/ergonomic keyboards because of wrist problems, and when my many Microsoft Natural 4000 keycaps wear out (as they all do!) I plan on replacing each one with this Cloud Nine C989M! What a joy! I haven't even played around with the customization settings yet, but I already love this keyboard. Nice and heavy, stays put, ergonomic, light-up, and - best of all for me - CLICKY!! I love the Cherry MX Brown mechanicals. This is my new favorite purchase! Get one if you use a MSN4000 and want the clicky, beautiful look of this keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: sipy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: One half may not work if you plug in cable wrong which is a pain. Even after reversing cable you may need to replug the keyboard into your pc to get both halves to work Great keyboard. Feels good. Takes a little time to get use to. Keys are smaller than microsoft ergo but they are functional. Very ergonomic and adjustable cause its split. For this price. It cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: RamenIsGood

customer_reviews.title: Dont move this around too much
customer_reviews.text: I am a programmer, so I stay typing. I bought a lift for my keyboard so I could stand. This keyboard restarts every time the lift moves up or down, its the wire in the back. Its loose.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. The ergonomics, the customizable color schemas, the feel of the key click. Great product. Expensive but worth every penny if you are typing all day long.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moroz

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but cheaper one is identical
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 to try them out and they are identical don't waist $ and get the cheaper one
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard... If it worked...
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal piece of crap. F keys throw out signal for no reason, unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Sinvex

customer_reviews.title: nice keyboard but with two issues in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: The layout is great, software is among the best I've used, and layout is good. But it has one flaw - it does not have a Windows key on the left hand side. Unfortunately, that's where I like to have it. So, it's been a problem for me. Also, the keyclick feel isn't what I had hoped for. I had never used Cherry MX Browns before. However, the quality is very good. It feels very sturdy. Still gave it high marks for being a very good quality keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Full Sized Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: With all the working from home I've been doing, I decided to treat my hands to a better experience. While I'm not a programmer or typist, I do consider myself a power user (at least with Excel). This was the only split keyboard I could find with a full number pad built-in which was a MUST for me. Also, the keys have a far nicer feel that the typical cheap keyboards I've always used. It has a really quality feel and so far has kept my hands happily typing all day.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hulse

product_meta.title: Cloud Nine C989M Ergonomic Mechanical Keyboard - Cherry MX Brown Switches - RGB Light Up LED Backlit with USB - Ergo Split Key Board with Macro for PC
feature_bullets: Split keyboard design helps eliminate wrist and shoulder pain while you type. By keeping your hands and arms properly aligned, this ergo keyboard helps provide pain-free typing for 8 plus hours a day.

Built-in tenting and palm support ensures your hands stay comfortable all day. With 7 degrees of angle built into the wrist rests, this full-sized keyboard keeps you in typing bliss because your hands stay in their natural position.

Do you suffer from sore wrists, RSI Symptoms, Carpal Tunnel, or Arthritis? This keyboard can help - It can be separated up to 6 inches keeping your arms & wrists ergonomically aligned. This reduces the stress you feel after typing for long periods.

Cherry MX Brown switches provide low activation force with a satisfying tactile feel. The RGB backlit keys ensure all characters are illuminated and are easy to read. Each back light color is easily selectable with the included app.

Works as a business or gaming keyboard. Whether you're at the office getting work done or playing a FPS game at home, this PC keyboard is ready. It has pro-level features like a full number keypad, 10x programmable macro keys, and a USB pass through.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars60 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
